channel.title: R on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in R on A Hugo website

item.title: Boxplot with trend line
item.description: Background Last week my colleague showed me a drawn graph and asked can we plot this kind of graph. It is a graph with grouped boxplot. Additionally, it contains a trend line that connects mean of the each data box. So this post explains how to draw a graph like that using two ways; r ggplot2 library r base plots (used codes from The R Graph Gallery - https://www.r-graph-gallery.com/146-boxplot-for-time-series/) The data This data is sample data set from my collegue.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
